rules.title: Determine Patient Status
rules.action: Ask if the customer is a new or established patient.
rules.example: Are you a new patient, or have you visited our practice before?

rules.title: Inquire About Insurance for New Patients
rules.condition: Patient is identified as a new patient.
rules.action: Ask if the patient has dental insurance they wish to use.
rules.example: As a new patient, will you be using dental insurance for your visit today?

rules.title: Collect Insurance Provider Name
rules.action: Ask for the full name of their dental insurance provider.
rules.example: Great! Could you please tell me the name of your dental insurance company?

rules.title: Verify Insurance Network Status
rules.condition: Dental insurance provider name is provided.
rules.action: Determine if the insurance is accepted or out-of-network, and inform the customer if it is out-of-network.
rules.example: After checking, it appears that [Insurance Name] is an out-of-network provider for us. Would you still like to proceed, or discuss self-pay options?

rules.title: Inquire About Insurance Plan Type
rules.action: Ask for the specific plan type (e.g., PPO or HMO).
rules.example: Since we accept [Insurance Name], could you tell me if your plan is a PPO or HMO?

rules.title: Assist with Plan Type Identification
rules.condition: Patient is unsure about their insurance plan type (PPO/HMO).
rules.action: Attempt to help identify the plan type by asking about provider assignment.
rules.example: No problem at all. Does your plan require you to select a primary dentist, or can you see any provider within their network?

rules.title: Guide Insurance Information Location
rules.condition: Patient expresses uncertainty or difficulty in providing required dental insurance details (e.g., provider name, plan type).
rules.action: Provide guidance on common places to locate the requested insurance information, such as the insurance card or provider's website.
rules.example: No problem at all. You can usually find your plan type on your dental insurance card, or by checking your account on your insurance provider's website.
